title: White House requests proposals for regulating novel commercial space activities
summary: The White House will ask federal agencies for their proposals for how to authorize and supervise emerging commercial space capabilities that don’t fit into current regulatory regimes.

title: KT SAT orders Koreasat 6A communications satellite from Thales
summary: Thales Alenia Space said Sept. 17 it has signed a contract to deliver a communications satellite for South Korea’s KT SAT in the fourth quarter of 2024.

title: Photos: Firefly’s second Alpha rocket raised on launch pad
summary: These photos show Firefly Aerospace’s second Alpha rocket as it was raised on its launch pad at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on Sept. 10. Photographers captured these views on the eve of the rocket’s planned test flight carrying seven small satellites into orbit.

title: Firefly scrubs second Alpha demonstration flight
summary: With the goal of successfully reaching orbit, Firefly is set to launch FLTA002 – its second demonstration flight of the Alpha launch vehicle – on the mission dubbed “To The Black.” Launching from Space Launch Complex 2 West (SLC-2W) at the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, the vehicle was scheduled to lift off on Sunday, Sept. 11 in a window from 3:00 to 7:00 PM PDT (22:00 to 02:00 UTC). Sunday’s launch attempt was scrubbed following an abort less than a minute before the opening of the window and subsequent delays throughout the window.

title: Starlink keeps this former Tesla employee online in the desert
summary: Starlink is keeping everyone connected, including a former Tesla employee who went viral on TikTok for his dome in the desert. While...

title: This should be the absolute peak of hurricane season—but it’s dead quiet out there
summary: Seasonal activity is running 50 percent below normal levels.

title: CAPSTONE enters safe mode during trajectory correction maneuver
summary: A NASA-funded cubesat mission to the moon has gone into safe mode after suffering a problem during a trajectory correction maneuver, the agency said Sept. 10.

title: SpaceX launches 52nd Falcon 9 rocket in 52 weeks
summary: SpaceX has completed its 52nd successful Falcon 9 launch in 52 weeks, sustaining an average cadence of one launch per week for...

title: Court approves sale of Masten assets to Astrobotic
summary: A federal bankruptcy court approved the sale of nearly all the assets of Masten Space Systems, a company developing a lunar lander for a NASA mission, to another lander developer, Astrobotic.

title: SpaceX ramps hiring for T-Mobile Starlink cell service partnership
summary: SpaceX is ramping hiring efforts for its T-Mobile Starlink cell service partnership. Last month, SpaceX and T-Mobile announced their new partnership to...
